First part here is that we want to be stretching regularly.
Now, stretching for you as a Jujitsu athlete holds a few key benefits.
First is that when you're training Jujitsu, you are going to be building tension through some very
specific areas. So having a stretching practice after training is going to allow you to undo that
tension so that you can go to sleep and recover well and down-regulate your nervous system.
The second part of stretching is that it's going to allow you to open up new areas and new
positions. So some of the work that we'll do in our training, some of what's going to happen to
us in daily life, sitting down, sitting in a car and whatnot makes the body tight. So by having a
stretching practice, it's going to allow you to open the body up to get into new positions.
This will not only allow you to perform better on the mats because you can now move better,
but it's also going to mean that instead of breaking when someone puts you into a position that might
be a bit awkward for you, your body already has some familiarity there. That's a really important

for what happens in Jujitsu. We are working at end ranges throughout the whole body and the way that
